extraChIPs 0.99.5

Coerce a column to a GRanges object

Source: R/colAsRanges.R
colAsRanges-methods.Rd

Coerce a column to a GRanges object

colAsRanges(x, var, ...)

# S4 method for DataFrame,character
colAsRanges(x, var, ...)

# S4 method for GRanges,character
colAsRanges(x, var, ...)

# S4 method for data.frame,character
colAsRanges(x, var, ...)

Arguments

x

A data-frame or GRanges object containing the column to coerce
var

The name of the column to coerce
...

Not used

Value

A GenomicRanges object

Details

Take a data.frame-like object and coerce one column to a GRanges object, setting the remainder as the mcols

Examples

x <- GRanges(c("chr1:1-10", "chr1:6-15", "chr1:51-60"))
df <- data.frame(logFC = rnorm(3), logCPM = rnorm(3,8), p = 10^-rexp(3))
gr <- mergeByCol(x, df, col = "logCPM", pval = "p")
colAsRanges(gr, "keyval_range")
#> GRanges object with 2 ranges and 7 metadata columns:
#>       seqnames    ranges strand | n_windows      n_up    n_down    logCPM
#>          <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <integer> <integer> <integer> <numeric>
#>   [1]     chr1      6-15      * |         2         0         1   8.74718
#>   [2]     chr1     51-60      * |         1         0         1   7.06518
#>            logFC         p       fdr
#>        <numeric> <numeric> <numeric>
#>   [1] -1.0059973 0.0498356 0.0498356
#>   [2] -0.0843389 0.0111776 0.0223551
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
